body_html:
Looks good to me. Bazel's config_setting rules don't actually change the way things are built -- they're a way to trigger a conditional, which then can affect anything that pays attention to config rules, like bazel.rc or select() rules.

AFAIK, we've always built by using --config= directly, so this change should be fine.
body_text:
Looks good to me. Bazel's config_setting rules don't actually change the way things are built -- they're a way to trigger a conditional, which then can affect anything that pays attention to config rules, like bazel.rc or select() rules.
AFAIK, we've always built by using --config= directly, so this change should be fine.
body:
Looks good to me. Bazel's config_setting rules don't actually change the way things are built -- they're a way to trigger a conditional, which then can affect anything that pays attention to config rules, like bazel.rc or select() rules.

AFAIK, we've always built by using --config=<option> directly, so this change should be fine.
